form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Paul introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To exempt intercollegiate athletic conferences and interstate intercollegiate athletic associations from the antitrust laws.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Collegiate Sports Integrity Act.

section.header: Antitrust exemption for intercollegiate athletic conferences and associations

paragraph.text: The term antitrust laws has the meaning given the term in the first section of the Clayton Act (15 U.S.C. 12), except that such term includes section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (15 U.S.C. 45) to the extent such section 5 applies to unfair methods of competition.
The term institution of higher education has the meaning given the term in section 101 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001).
The term intercollegiate athletic conference means—

clause.text: exclusively has as members 2 or more institutions of higher education; and
arranges championships and sets rules for intercollegiate athletic competition; or

subparagraph.text: any institution of higher education that competes against another institution of higher education in an athletic competition.

paragraph.text: The term interstate intercollegiate athletic association—

subparagraph.text: means a not-for-profit corporation, an association, or any other group organized in the United States that—

clause.text: sponsors or arranges intercollegiate athletic competition between institutions and intercollegiate athletic conferences;
sets common rules, standards, procedures, or guidelines for the administration of intercollegiate athletic competition at institutions; and
is composed of 2 or more institutions or conferences that are located in different States; and

subparagraph.text: does not include a corporation, association, or other group affiliated with professional athletic competition.

subsection.text: The antitrust laws shall not apply to intercollegiate athletic conferences or interstate intercollegiate athletic associations.
